main event: In January 1958, there were multiple sightings of a large, greenish, fiery object in the sky reported by civilians and even law enforcement in Virginia. The object was described as round with a short cone trailing, 10-20 feet in diameter, and with a glowing, greenish face.
interesting points: Multiple witnesses reported seeing a large, fiery object in the sky over Virginia, creating concern in the Roanoke Valley area.
The object was described as having a greenish face, appearing round with a short cone trailing, and being 10-20 feet in diameter.
Law enforcement as well as civilians reported these sightings, adding credibility to the reports.

The Air Force acknowledged the sighting, stating that it had not been conclusively identified and that the report would be used as part of the Air Force's continuing study on unidentified aerial phenomena.
The witnesses described the object as appearing to be of metallic form, and one witness reported observing the object hovering for several minutes.
photographs: no photographs included in the report
